result.heading: FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY 1 CREDITS BEGIN OVER BLACK

dialogue.raw_text: a man in his 70s, narrates nostalgically OVER a MONTAGE of related news photos.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: was a big year. The Russians put that Sputnik into outer space, the Dodgers played their last game at Ebbets Field, 'that guy' shot Frank Costello in the head, and missed, and the Gallo brothers whacked Albert Anastasia in that barber shop in the Park Sheraton Hotel. It was total chaos. With Anastasia gone, Vito Genovese figures he's king shit, but Carlo Gambino and 'Joe Bananas' both want to be boss of all bosses. So they call a meeting -- a big meeting. 2   EXT. UPSTATE NEW YORK - DAY                                  2 CREDITS CONTINUE. In FADED 16mm documentary-style, we see a country road winding through rolling hills. At the top of the hill, a black '57 Cadillac appears and sweeps through the peaceful landscape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was the first time the whole commission was ever gonna meet face to face. Bosses and wiseguys were comin' in from all over the country, and all the New York families, too -- maybe sixty bosses, the whole wiseguy world -- all headin' toward this little town upstate to figure out what's what. 3   EXT. ROADSIDE - DAY                                          3 A sign reads, "Entering Apalachin - pop. 342." The black Cadillac speeds past the sign, then another black Caddy, then a black Lincoln, then another Caddy, a Lincoln, etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your father and me, we were goin' up with Tommy D., Fat Tommy. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 3   CONTINUED:                                                    3 MANETTA (V.O.CONT'D) He was running the family at the time. Anyway, I don't know what anybody was thinking, but some asshole thought it would be a good idea to have this meeting at Joe Babara's farm in the country where nobody would notice. 4   EXT. RURAL GAS STATION - DAY                                  4 A local state police deputy is gassing up his motorcycle when the parade of shiny black cars rolls by. He looks up and scratches his head at the unusual sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turns out the local cops were watching Joe Babara like a hawk. So now you got about fifty Caddies and Lincolns pullin' into Apalachin and some deputy sheriff with cow shit on his shoes notices all the traffic and calls the Feds. 5   EXT. JOE BABARA'S ESTATE - DAY                                5 The Caddies and Lincolns are all parked around a rambling country manor. Bosses and wiseguys are meeting and greeting each other on the big front porch. One WISEGUY is trying to shoo a cow away from his car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanna be a ribeye?   Get away from the fuckin' car. 6   EXT. WOODS - SAME TIME                                        6 Federal agents start moving in quietly, heavily-armed, wearing big FBI arm bands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The meeting never even got started. The Feds moved in -- 7   EXT. HOUSE - DAY                                              7 Agents with weapons drawn charge the house and start breaking down the front door.

direction.raw_text: Your papa and me hid in a field with hay or corn, some kinda foliage, I don't know. 9    EXT. FARM FIELD - DAY                                           9 Two wiseguys in suits crouch in the tall grass. Suddenly they see a John Deere harvester bearing down on them.

direction.raw_text: Then along comes this farmer who almost runs us over in a tractor, so your father hauls out his piece, this .44 cannon he used to carry, and hijacks the goddamn tractor. Funniest fuckin' thing I ever saw. 10   EXT. COUNTRY ROAD - DAY                                         10 The farmer goes flying off the harvester and the two wiseguys drive off on it. The farmer looks up to see the John Deere disappear in a swirling cloud of dust that FILLS the SCREEN. END CREDITS.

RITZ CLAM BOX - LATE AFTERNOON (PRESENT) The place is nearly empty. Manetta is talking to PAUL VITTI, a dark, intense, intelligent man in his late forties, and a powerful boss in his own right.

direction.raw_text: Anyway, Carlo Gambino came out of it capo de tutti capi, and that was the last time the whole commission tried to meet -- until now.

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I don't like it. What do we need a meeting for? Let everybody worry about their own business. They finish eating.

direction.raw_text: The '57 meeting was about how we were going to divide up the whole country. This meeting is about how we're gonna survive. You got 'made' guys informing for the Feds; bosses going to jail; everybody's dealing drugs; people are getting whacked without permission. And on top of everything, now we got the Chinese Triads and these crazy Russians to deal with. Everything's changing. We need a leader. Someone with fresh ideas. Someone like you. It's gonna be a new century, Paul. We gotta change with the times.

Vitti's bodyguard, JELLY, grabs him and throws him behind the counter, shielding him with his body. Outside, the shooting has stopped and curious bystanders are looking in the broken windows. Vitti's eyes well up with tears.

direction.raw_text: I kept telling him that I needed room to grow and find myself as a person. Not just as a woman but as an independent entity. BEN SOBOL her therapist, seems to be listening intently.

direction.raw_text: I told him I needed to get in touch with my uniqueness, but he couldn't handle that. He said I was driving him away. Do you think I was driving him away, Dr. Sobol? Ben leans forward sympathetically. (CONTINUED)

Please, say something interesting before I lapse into a goddamn coma! Caroline looks curiously at Ben, unperturbed.

direction.raw_text: Dr. Sobol? BEN Lost in his fantasy, not really listening.    He comes to attention and tries to cover. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: Yes. Yes. I was just reflecting on your whole -- situation. It's very interesting what you were just saying. Vitti picks up the gun and puts it to Tino's head. Tino shuts his eyes and turns away, expecting the shot, but then Vitti's hand starts to shake and he breaks into a cold sweat. direction.raw_text: Good scene.    Was I there? A mourner walks up to Vitti, bows his head in respect and kisses Vitti on both cheeks. Vitti on both cheeks. Vitti gives him a consoling pat on the shoulder, then the man kisses Ben and walks off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You dropped your gun, then you ran over to me and started yelling, 'Papa, Papa!'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was Fredo.    I don't think so. An older woman kisses Vitti's hand, then both his cheeks. Vitti whispers a few words to her, then she kisses Ben's hand and moves on. More old ladies kiss their hands as they walk by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're losing it, Doc.   You may need therapy yourself. A man comes up to Vitti, kisses him on both cheeks, embraces him with excessive energy, then repeats the whole scene with Ben and exits. Ben looks at Vitti.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Him I don't know. Let's get private. 65A   OMITTED                                                         65A &                                                                     & 65B
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHURCH - MOMENTS LATER                                     66 Ben and Vitti come out of the cathedral.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you see? You called me 'Papa.' It's all about your father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you, nuts? It was your dream. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 66   CONTINUED:                                                     66 BEN Yes, but that's what your black milk dream was about, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-uh. I don't buy it. In my dream, I'm bringing the baby the black milk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freud believed you're everyone in your dreams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well, that guy I don't need to hear about. I can't even call my mother on the phone after that thing you told me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's say you are the baby. What kind of milk did you get from your father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could we stop talking about my father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the whole point! We have to start talking about your father. You know what it's like dealing with you? This is you. (imitating Vitti) You gotta help me, Doc. I'm a mess. I'm in pain. (as himself) Okay, Paul, I can help you. (as Vitti) Fuck you. Nobody helps Paul Vitti.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very good. Now I'll do you. 'Boo-fuckin'-hoo.' I never said this would be easy. Let's see how you like it. Let's talk about your father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's not. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 66   CONTINUED:    (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he still alive?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, he's still alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of work does he do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not important.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You paused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You paused. That means you had a feeling. What does he do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a psychiatrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ooh, you're fucked up.   Next patient, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're running out of time, Paul. Let's not waste it talking about my problems.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your father's a problem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what you just said!   You seem upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not upset!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I'm good at this. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 66    CONTINUED:    (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have three days left. If you want to spend it screwing around, I can't help you. (hailing a taxi) Call me when you're ready to get serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say hello to your father for me! A cab stops at the curb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 66A   EXT. CHURCH - SAME TIME                                           66A Handsome Jack and Potatoes watch from a vantage point in the park nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We could just pop him right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In front of a church? What are you, a fuckin' animal? It's a holy place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is the sidewalk holy, too? I mean, where does the holiness end?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Second Avenue?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 67    OMITTED                                                           67 &                                                                       & 68                                                                      68 69    DIGITAL SOUND MIXER                                               69 in the FBI van. A technician works at the computer console. Steadman listens. Through speakers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want me to whack my doctor? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 69   CONTINUED:                                                       69 MASIELLO (V.O.) If you don't do it, somebody else will. It's the only way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Nobody touches him. You hear me? Anybody lays a finger on him, I'll kill 'em. Is that clear? Then the technician plays an altered version.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want me to whack my doctor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you don't do it, somebody else will. It's the only way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll kill 'em.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want me to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 71   INT. JIMMY'S CAR - SAME TIME                                     71 Jimmy is parked at the corner watching the Sobol house as the three FBI agents leave. CUT TO: 72   EXT. OLD LION SOCIAL CLUB - LATE AFTERNOON                       72 Masiello is face to face with Vitti.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paul, he talked to the Feds. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 72   CONTINUED:                                                      72 VITTI I know this guy. He would never talk to the Feds. Jelly's CELLULAR PHONE RINGS. He steps away and answers it quietly during the following.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The FBI was at his house today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the truth.   I saw 'em.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll see. Next thing is he's gonna call you and ask for a meeting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on.   You don't know this guy. Jelly covers the phone and turns to Vitti.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Dr. Sobol. He says he needs to see you right away. Vitti nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 73   EXT. STREET CORNER - NIGHT                                      73 Ben waits on a deserted corner in Brooklyn. A black Town Car appears and stops to pick him up. The windows are heavily tinted. Ben takes a deep breath, crosses to the car and opens the back door. EXT. JELLY'S CAR - CONTINUOUS ACTION Ben finds Jelly sitting in the back seat next to Vitti.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit up front with Jimmy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want me to sit in front? Paul usually sits in front. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 73   CONTINUED:                                                        73 JIMMY So this time you'll sit up front. Why you making a federal case?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Federal case? I'm not making a federal case? Let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 74   INT. PARETTI'S RESTAURANT (JERSEY CITY) - LATER                   74 A waiter pours red wine. Ben is eating out of pure anxiety. Jelly and Jimmy watch him intently. Vitti stares off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow, this is really good. Delicious. I love Italian food. I've never been to Italy but I'd love to go. I've been to France. And Jamaica. That's nice, but I'm sure it's very different from Italy. A whole different, uh -- (silence) So what's everybody doing this summer? Carlo Mangano comes to the table. Vitti gets up, hugs and fraternal kisses all around, then Mangano sits down with them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Ben. He's a friend of mine. (to Ben) Say hello to Carlo Mangano.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How you doin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carlo was on my father's crew. He's always been like a -- I don't know -- like a cousin to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am your cousin. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 74   CONTINUED:                                                       74 VITTI I know, that's what I'm saying. It's like a family thing. The closeness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything you need, anything I can do for you, Paul, you know. I'm here for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. So did you take care of that thing I asked you about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it all right to talk business in front of your friend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I took care of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about that other thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm waiting for that first thing to come through. I can't move until it does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did the guy give you a problem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little.    He's a lunatic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 75   INT. FBI VAN - SAME TIME                                         75 The agents monitor the conversation through the bug Ben is wearing. They shake their heads at the incomprehensible dialogue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did he say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The usual. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 75   CONTINUED:                                                      75 VITTI (V.O.) Did you tell him you weren't going for it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was I gonna do? 76   BACK IN PARETTI'S                                               76 VITTI You always gotta nip that shit in the bud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. But if the first thing is okay, that should fix everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Including the second thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but -- VITTI Exactly. (to Ben) Don't repeat any of that to anyone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? The first thing or the second thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's Stevie Beef over there. I gotta go say hello to him for a second. (to Mangano) Come on. Ben watches Vitti and Mangano cross the room, then turns to Jelly and Jimmy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stevie Beef. Interesting name. When he was younger they probably called him Stevie Veal. (off no response) You guys come here often?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paretti's has a very special meaning to Paul. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 76   CONTINUED:                                                        76 JIMMY Yeah, this is where his father got whacked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the big secret?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a second. Paul's father was murdered?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right at that table.   With his whole family there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, just shut up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paul, too?   He was there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He don't like to talk about it. Everything is suddenly clear to Ben.      He stands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you goin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll go with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta -- you know -- poop. Ben goes into a stall, latches the door and drops his pants. Jelly combs his hair in the mirror. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 77   CONTINUED:                                                       77 INT. STALL - SAME TIME Ben hastily unbuttons his shirt, revealing a small microphone taped to his chest. He picks at the edge of the tape, takes a deep breath, then rips it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahhhh! JELLY at the urinal, reacts to Ben's cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need more roughage. A bran muffin in the morning would help with that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 78   INT. PARETTI'S - BACK AT TABLE - FEW MINUTES LATER               78 Ben and Jelly rejoin Vitti.      Ben starts right in on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to talk to you -- in private.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave us alone. They exit without hesitation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you tell me about your father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said he died of a heart attack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what's the problem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the problem?   Your father was murdered! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 78   CONTINUED:                                                      78 VITTI Heart attack, murdered, what's the difference? He's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a big difference.   Why didn't you tell me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because it's private. You think I tell you every little thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is not a little thing!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, you want to know? Analyze this. I was twelve years old, the whole family was having dinner together right over there, two guys walked in and shot him dead right in front of us. Okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you didn't think this was important enough to tell me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What am I supposed to do? Spend the rest of my life crying about the past? Forget about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what? I think you want to talk about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I don't want to talk about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why did you choose this restaurant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Cause I like it, okay? (CONTINUED) ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 6/25/98                                  99. 78    CONTINUED:    (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of all the places we could've gone, why this one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: White clam sauce. The best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, we're here because you wanted me to know about your father. You're reaching out to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll reach out to you -- Vitti suddenly reaches over and rips Ben's shirt open. All he sees is a bald patch on Ben's chest where the bug was taped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we have some major trust issues here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 78A   INT. SINDONE HEADQUARTERS - SAME TIME                              78A The cutting room is deserted except for Primo and his men. Sindone is at his desk reading the entertainment section of the New York Times.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to see a movie but there's nothing out there. It's all this shoot-'em-up action bullshit. I get enough of that at work. They all laugh.     Moony finishes a call on his cell phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was our friend. He marked your guy at Paretti's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? Then let's make it the last supper. Jack?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got it, Primo. (to Potatoes) Let's go. (CONTINUED) ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 6/25/98                                99A. 78A   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as they exit) Hey, Jack. Just for fun, tear out his heart and bring it to me. CUT TO: 79    EXT. STREET - LATER                                               79 Vitti, Ben and the boys come out of the restaurant and walk to the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jimmy, you can have shotgun this time. I don't mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah, sit up front. There's more room for your legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My legs are short, it's fine in the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get in the front.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what? It's late. I think I'm just going to call it a night. Why don't I just grab a cab and head on home. (CONTINUED) ANALYZE THIS - 6/17/98                                       100. 79    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get in the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No really, it's all right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get in the fucking car. Ben looks to Vitti for help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do what he says.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, we call this a transference neurosis. It's when the patient starts acting out his problems with his therapist instead of out in the world. It's usually considered a good sign. Not for me, in this case, but -- Jimmy forces him into the back of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 79A   EXT. PARETTI'S RESTAURANT - MOMENTS LATER                           79A The Lincoln makes a U-turn in front of Paretti's and drives off down the street passing Handsome Jack and Potatoes in a car parked at the corner. The car takes off after the Lincoln. CUT TO: 80    INT. FBI VAN - SAME TIME                                            80 The agents are monitoring the bug, but all they hear is WATER RUNNING and TOILETS FLUSHING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's he doing in there? He's been in the bathroom for half an hour. Ricci and Steadman look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : ANALYZE THIS - 6/17/98                                   101. 81   EXT. PARETTI'S RESTAURANT - MOMENTS LATER                       81 The FBI van pulls up and lurches to a stop. CUT TO: 82   INT. PARETTI'S BATHROOM - MOMENTS LATER                         82 Steadman rushes in, pushes open the stall and sees the microphone and transmitter in the bottom of the toilet bowl. SCRAP YARD - NIGHT (LATER)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave us alone. Jelly looks apologetically at Ben.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, Doc.    It's not personal, you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't kid yourself, Jelly. It doesn't get more personal than this. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 85   CONTINUED:                                                       85 Jelly and Jimmy walk away, leaving Ben alone with Vitti.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know why I have to do this, don't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you're a paranoid? No, actually you're a reverse paranoid. You think you're out to get everybody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't bullshit me! You betrayed me! You stabbed me in the back. They start shouting at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I betrayed you? What are you talking about? Who's got the gun?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I'm an idiot? Don't insult my intelligence. You cooperated! You talked to the Feds!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They played me a tape! You said you were going to kill me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never.   I never said that. They glare at each other for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't matter. I didn't betray you, Paul. Yes, they made me wear a wire, but I took it off, because I think I know how to help you now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to know what you think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, you do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I don't! (CONTINUED) ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 6/10/98                              103. 85   CONTINUED:    (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's over! Don't you get it? I took one chance and that's it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. (as Vitti cocks the gun) Can I ask you one last question?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you order?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you order?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That night. What were you eating the night your father got killed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How the hell do I know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't remember?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was 35 years ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did your father have?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you!   I don't remember.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Try. (CONTINUED) ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 6/10/98                                104. 85   CONTINUED:    (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a simple question.    What was your father eating!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Penne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good.    And you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ravioli.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The food was on the table?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were just serving it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you see the guys coming?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of them.   Dressed like a busboy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did your father see him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, but I knew he looked wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His pants. They looked too good for a busboy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He walked over to the table?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I watched him the whole way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you say anything? (CONTINUED) ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 6/10/98                              105. 85   CONTINUED:    (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My father was so mad at me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you were mad at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't say anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never saw the second guy.    My mother started screaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you blame yourself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I coulda saved him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you were mad at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I killed my father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't kill him, Paul. You were angry but you didn't kill him. That's the life he chose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never got to say good-bye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say it now, Paul. Talk to him. What do you want to tell him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to.   Tell him, Paul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. I'm so sorry. (CONTINUED) ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 6/10/98                              106. 85   CONTINUED:    (5)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay, Paul. You can let go of it now. Vitti leans back against the car, slumps to the ground and starts sobbing, 35 years of pent-up grief finally finding expression. 86   JELLY AND JIMMY                                                 86 Standing around smoking, waiting for the death shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's taking so long?   I'm ruining my goddamn shoes here.   Fuckin' $350 Bruno Maglis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong with you? Don't you have any respect? This is a very difficult thing for Paul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shoulda let me do it. I'd be home watchin' E.S.P.N.2 by now. World's strongest man. You should see these guys. 87   VITTI AND BEN                                                   87 Ben is comforting Vitti.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You couldn't save him, Paul. He was trying to save you. That's what you fought about. He didn't want this for you, and you don't want it for Anthony. You don't want him to grow up the way you did -- without a father. Vitti just cries louder. 88   JELLY AND JIMMY                                                 88 hearing the crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, the guy's fallin' apart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why doesn't he just pop him?   It's embarrassing. ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 6/10/98                            106A. 89   BEN AND VITTI                                                89 Ben tries to comfort Vitti who is still crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your father's not dead, Paul. He's alive -- in you. And he's trying to tell you something. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 89   CONTINUED:                                                          89 Suddenly, there is a GUNSHOT and a BULLET RICOCHETS off the TOP of the CAR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my God! 90   HANDSOME JACK                                                       90 He OPENS UP with a MAC-10. JELLY AND JIMMY Jimmy goes down, hit in the shoulder.      Jelly dives for cover behind a rusted car body. VITTI AND BEN BEN (in a panic) Paul!   They're shooting! Vitti continues to sob, oblivious to the GUN BATTLE raging around him. JELLY He FIRES back at Handsome Jack. POTATOES He rakes the Lincoln with a BURST from the ASSAULT RIFLE. JELLY'S CAR All the WINDOWS ARE BLOWN OUT by the GUNFIRE.     Ben screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. You tripped over your unconscious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 116   EXT. FEDERAL PRISON - MANY WEEKS LATER                         116 It's a beautiful summer day. Convicts are playing basketball and lounging in the yard. CUT TO: 117   INT. PRISON LIBRARY - SAME TIME                                117 Ben in a sport coat, and Vitti, in prison whites, are sitting around in a circle with several other convicts. DONNY, a heavyweight con with a shaved head and numerous tattoos is talking. (CONTINUED) 130. 117   CONTINUED:                                                         117 DONNY I don't think my mother really listens when I talk. She never listened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And how does that make you feel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It makes me feel angry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll bet you feel hurt, too, don't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paul, what would you say about what Donny's feeling?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Donny, when you're thirsty, you don't go to the wall -- you go to the well. You know what I'm saying? Your mother may never be able to listen to you, but you have friends here who will. Okay? Ben is proud of Vitti's new sensitivity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And be patient, Donny. Most people's problems take months, sometimes years to resolve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm doing twenty-five to life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That should be plenty of time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 118   INT. PRISON CORRIDOR - LATER                                       118 Ben and Vitti have just left the therapy group. (CONTINUED) 131. 118   CONTINUED:                                                        118 BEN You know they found Primo Sindone dead in a field near LaGuardia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard. (off Ben's look) I had nothing to do with it. There were guys lined up from Canarsie to Atlantic City who wanted to whack that bastard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, just checking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, Doc, I don't think I ever thanked you properly for curing me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't say 'cured.' We say you had a 'corrective emotional experience.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You, you, you're very good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.   You. You.
direction.name: direction

A great TONY BENNETT SONG can be heard playing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just can't get used to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 120   CONTINUED:                                                       120 LAURA It's been three weeks since the last time you were kidnapped. I don't know if I can adjust. They kiss as the SONG ENDS.    Ben turns and speaks to someone O.S.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you say, Tony?   One more? TONY BENNETT and his trio are set up on the back porch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever you want, Dr. Sobol. My friend told me to stay as long as you wanted me. What do you want to hear, Mrs. Sobol?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your choice, Tony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was hoping you'd say that. (quietly, to trio) 'World on a String,' fellas. Tony sings "I've Got the World on a String" as Ben and Laura continue to dance. The CAMERA PANS UP and we see Michael smiling and shooting video from his bedroom window, then the CAMERA PANS UP TO a starry sky, and we...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They get up to leave. Vitti drops some money on the table. Bodyguards follow them to the door. The waiters and the owner bow to them as they pass. They are almost out the door when Vitti hesitates.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (low and deadly, pumping up the cuff with the squeeze-ball)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ben looks to Vitti for a response.    Vitti stares at him for a long, uncomfortable beat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Vitti bends over and starts drawing in the sand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: and if you make one more move on me I swear to God I'll cut your fuckin' balls off and shove 'em up your ass!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get a dictionary and find out what this 'closure' is. If that's what he's hitting us with, I want to know what the hell it is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, right up until the shoving the balls. You can't keep doing this! You want to get physical? Take a walk. Get a punching bag. Hit a pillow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jelly's car pulls into a scrap metal yard and parks. They all get out. Jelly hands Vitti a gun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's different when I say it. When you say it, it sounds very negative.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry, Jelly, but I'm not going. I'm not on the payroll anymore, so forget about it. My wife is waiting --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Correction. Mr. Vitti couldn't shoot you. But here's something about me you should know. I never got married, Doctor Sobol. I don't have a hobby. I never got a dog or a cat. I don't even have a goldfish. I live for one reason only, and that's to serve Mr. Paul Vitti. He's what I'm thinking about when I wake up, and he's what I'm thinking about when I close my eyes to sleep. If he told me to jump off a tall building, not only would I do it, I would hope to survive so I could do it again and again until he told me to stop. This is all I know. This is all I got. So please don't think I won't kill you, because I'd hate for your last thought to be a wrong one. You're going to that meeting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good thinking. I was going to bring a machine gun but I don't have one. Of course, we haven't opened the wedding gifts yet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (on a loudspeaker) Drop your weapons and lie facedown on the ground. I repeat. Drop your weapons and lie facedown on the ground.
dialogue.name: dialogue
